Democrats stand with American workers by fighting to ensure you can retire with the financial peace of mind you’ve earned. Today we passed landmark bipartisan retirement legislation through the House. Our colleagues in the Senate must do the same. Details:  http://bit.ly/2JxKeeR

Because of the #GOPTaxLaw, #GoldStar families are now facing huge unexpected tax hikes. These families have sacrificed and suffered enough. Today, my colleagues and I are fixing this egregious wrong with a provision in the #SECUREAct. pic.twitter.com/dMh8CHQqwy

The #SECUREAct: 
1. Makes it easier for small businesses to offer retirement plans to their employees
2. Ensures home health care workers can receive retirement benefits
3. Eliminates unfair tax hikes on children in Gold Star families caused by the #GOPTaxLaw
Nearly two-thirds of Americans have ZERO retirement assets. This is a crisis – and it’s one we are actively working to fix by passing the #SECUREAct today. pic.twitter.com/ZqqiLqv7AW

Democrats are making sure that doesn’t happen by advancing landmark, bipartisan retirement legislation through the House. #RT to spread the word and make sure your family, friends & followers know about the #SECUREAct! pic.twitter.com/e5vm4Jh4X3

More than 30% of Americans believe they’ll either face financial hardship in retirement...

 or won’t be able to retire at all. pic.twitter.com/ha2sWs90d9
The #SECUREAct is comprehensive, bipartisan legislation that would help more Americans retire with financial peace of mind. Proud to cast my vote for its passage. http://bit.ly/2Qg066x

Transportation is now the #1 source of greenhouse gas emissions in the U.S. Our work to #ActOnClimate will fall short unless we help build infrastructure for cleaner vehicles. #LIFTAmerica has major funding for transportation electrification & electric vehicle charging stations!

We need to make sure every neighborhood & community can benefit from our investments in clean energy deployment. #LIFTAmerica includes $2.25 billion over 5 yrs to create new grant support for distributed energy systems & solar installations in low-income & underserved communities

We also know America’s energy grid is critical security infrastructure that faces threats including increasingly frequent and severe extreme weather events. A more resilient grid will keep us safer and help our communities better withstand these events.

#LIFTAmerica includes $4 billion over five years for electric grid infrastructure, including grid modernization & resilience upgrades. A smarter grid makes it easier for us to integrate renewable energy resources and superior demand response programs.

America’s Weatherization Assistance Program makes small but meaningful investments to get homes in better, more efficient condition. @ENERGY estimates an average annual savings of $283 per home from this cost-effective program!

My bill to reauthorize and modernize @ENERGY’s Weatherization Assistance Program (H.R. 2041) is part of #LIFTAmerica. This program has helped more than 7.4 million low-income households make their homes healthier, safer, and more efficient. pic.twitter.com/B3PECajRGU

#LIFTAmerica invests billions in energy efficiency including building retrofits. Buildings consume ~40% of total US energy demand. Despite cost-effective ways to promote efficiency, it’s still much harder than it should be for homeowners & local gov’ts to make these investments.
We know the #climatecrisis threatens countless American lives and livelihoods. #LIFTAmerica is a significant down payment on the infrastructure we need for America’s clean energy transition.

#LIFTAmerica also invests $2.7 billion over 5 years for EPA’s Brownfields program, an incredibly important & successful source of economic revitalization. This program has assessed more than 27,000 contaminated sites & cleaned up nearly 70,000 acres for reuse.

#LIFTAmerica provides $18.69 billion for essential drinking water programs including funding to get lead out of our schools and public water systems & $2.5 billion for #PFAS affected water systems to combat contamination through advanced treatment technologies!

If we continue to underinvest in these systems—especially as we learn more about the extent of our challenges from lead, #PFAS, and other contaminants—clean, reliable, and affordable water will only get harder and more costly for local communities to provide.

For years, I have been fighting for more resources for our nation’s aging drinking water systems. @EPA has estimated the needs of America’s drinking water systems over the next 20 years to be $473 billion!

We can build on the strong foundation of #LIFTAmerica with smart, enduring infrastructure improvements like those in our @SEEC infrastructure plan:  https://seec-tonko.house.gov/sites/sustainableenergyandenvironmentcoalitioncaucus.house.gov/files/documents/SEEC%20Sustainable%20Infrastructure%20Proposal%202.12.18.pdf … pic.twitter.com/u4FePKzzHI

Today, too many communities across America do not have access to broadband #internet service. The #LIFTAmerica Act invests $40 billion to deploy broadband infrastructure to communities nationwide that are being left behind in the digital economy. pic.twitter.com/gwiRHOVGpY

Access to safe drinking water is a necessity for us all, but unfortunately it is not a given. The #LIFTAmerica Act invests $21 billion to provide state and local govts funding to protect America’s drinking water!💧 pic.twitter.com/ZgAk1hOoKt
#LIFTAmerica also helps local communities integrate clean energy into developmental efforts to combat #ClimateChange, including an electric vehicle charging network. pic.twitter.com/joljBZ3QsS

Our #LIFTAmerica Act makes significant investments in clean energy as we work to #ActOnClimate. We need bold climate solutions that invest in the expansion of U.S. renewable energy & efficiency programs that reduce carbon pollution. pic.twitter.com/IZa1wRbJbk

Our nation’s #infrastructure is in desperate need of repair. I am proud to support the #LIFTAmerica Act that rebuilds America through investments to #actonclimate, expand broadband access and protect public health & our shared environment. pic.twitter.com/QDK42bpC57

These efforts force women to defend themselves, their rights & bodily autonomy over something deeply personal & too often painful. Criminalizing miscarriages is brutal and has no basis in science, medicine or ethics. The rights & safety of millions of Americans are at stake.

Across the country we are seeing a new wave of extreme bans on abortion, stripping away reproductive freedom & undermining access to safe medical care. It does not seem to matter that outlawing abortions does not stop them from happening, it only stops them from being done safely

This week has brought remarkable, disheartening attacks on women’s rights in America. Forcing a sexual assault survivor or any woman into the shadows to find basic, necessary medical care puts them in danger and violates their human rights. We are better than this. We have to be.

No amount of deception, misdirection or obstruction will keep us from fulfilling the Constitutional role of Congress to ensure transparency and accountability #ForThePeople. We have a duty to the truth and a responsibility to deliver it to those we serve.

After skipping out on his agreement to testify before the House Judiciary Committee last week, I firmly believe that the Attorney General needs to show his face and justify his actions to Congress and the American people.
His actions reveal America’s top law enforcement officer serving as the President’s defense attorney rather than upholding our laws and Constitution.

I also find that Attorney General Barr has repeatedly and seriously misrepresented the Special Counsel’s findings, including deceptive statements to Congress and the American people on multiple occasions.
...as well as the testimony of Robert Mueller himself, so that Congress and the American people can make informed choices about what it means and what should come next.
Given these findings, I strongly support Judiciary Committee Chairman Nadler’s call for the full unredacted report and underlying evidence...
The Special Counsel’s team found ample evidence of troubling and possibly illegal activity by the Trump campaign, including numerous actions that could amount to obstruction of justice.
Having taken the time necessary to review Special Counsel Mueller’s report in detail, I find the characterization of its findings by President Trump and Attorney General Barr profoundly misleading.

When the redacted version of Special Counsel Mueller's 448-page report into foreign election interference was released, I noted significant law enforcement actions that it has yielded and said I would take the time necessary to review it before making further comment. https://twitter.com/RepPaulTonko/status/1118897690186743808 …
